comments: First of all, this was the worst professor I\'ve ever had in my entire life, I am a 3.8 gpa student and have always done really well when it comes to studying. Usually professors are supposed to be on your side and use any possible tool to make the course easiest for their students. Dr. Carson however, could care less. Fully test based course

comments: Worst teacher ever. Lectures are long and boring. No hw, only grade you get is on 11 tests that you basically need to get all A\'s on to get a B in the class. She definitely has a high case of cheaterphobia and during tests she moves students around, breathes over your shoulder to check for cheating. Seriously is ridiculous. Dont recommend AT ALL.

Not forthefaint hearted. I will not take anything with her. Also she has some really odd behaviors, especially when it comes to testing.

comments: Prof Carson is a retired MD. She tried to add medicine to it.. Her lectures are long and boring. I try to listen, but I just can\'t. She does a test every week. Very detailed. Study guides are all over the place. She will say you have to know this then it won\'t be on test. She treats us like convicts during exams and thinks everyone is cheating

comments: I read every rating on Dr. Carson before I decided to take her class. The reviews did not do her justice. She is by far the worst professor I have ever had. I worry that she is teaching the next generation of med students, oh wait who am I kidding she doesn\'t teach. She lets us have "lab" aka teach yourself while she goes to the cafeteria.

comments: I\'m an "A" student who tries hard for all my classes, but Dr. Carson doesn\'t try in return to be a good professor. Her lectures are like nails on a chalk board and her refusal to use technology makes a three hour class feel like a six hour one. She tests every week and the tests ask very detailed questions. This is not an easy "A" class!

comments: Dr. Carson is a strange being. She seems nice at first, but she is very picky, especially when it comes to testing. She once ripped a sheet of paper out of my hand because she didn\'t like the way I was holding it. 11 total tests, all of which are hard. There aren\'t any labs, it\'s all lectures. Do not take, it\'s worth waiting an extra semester.

Questions on test can be worded weird.
